params.amounts: the amounts of each token to add, in their native precision according to the cardinality of 'tokens'
params.minToMint: the minimum LP tokens adding this amount of liquidity should mint, otherwise revert. Handy for front-running mitigation allowed addresses. If the pool is not in the guarded launch phase, this parameter will be ignored.

returns._0: amount of LP token user received

params.amount: the amount of LP tokens that would to be burned on withdrawal
params.tokens: the tokens of the pool in their cardinality [token0, token1]

returns._0: array of amounts of tokens user will receive

params.dx: the number of tokens to sell

returns.dy: the number of tokens the user will get

calculateTokenAmount(SwapUtils.PooledTok.details: This shouldn't be used outside frontends for user estimates.

params.amounts: an array of token amounts to deposit or withdrawal, corresponding to tokens. The amount should be in each pooled token's native precision.
params.deposit: whether this is a deposit or a withdrawal
params.tokens: Array of tokens in the pool          according to pool cardinality [token0, token1]

returns._0: if deposit was true, total amount of lp token that will be minted and if deposit was false, total amount of lp token that will be burned

getA(SwapUtils.Amplification storage).details: See the StableSwap paper for details

getAPrecise(SwapUtils.Amplification stor.details: See the StableSwap paper for details

returns._0: A parameter in its raw precision form
the virtual price, scaled to precision of POOL_PRECISION_DECIMALS

params.futureA_: the new A to ramp towards
params.futureTime_: timestamp when the new A should be reached

removeLiquidity(uint256,SwapUtils.Pooled.details: Liquidity can always be removed, even when the pool is paused.

params.amount: the amount of LP tokens to burn
params.minAmounts: the minimum amounts of each token in the pool acceptable for this burn. Useful as a front-running mitigation. Should be according to the cardinality of 'tokens'

returns._0: amounts of tokens the user receives for each token in the pool according to [token0, token1] cardinality

params.amounts: how much of each token to withdraw according to cardinality of pooled tokens
params.maxBurnAmount: the max LP token provider is willing to pay to remove liquidity. Useful as a front-running mitigation.

returns._0: actual amount of LP tokens burned in the withdrawal

params.minAmount: the minimum amount to withdraw, otherwise revert
params.tokenAmount: the amount of the lp tokens to burn
params.tokenCounterpart: the counterpart token in the pool of the token you want to receive
params.tokenReceive: the token you want to receive

returns._0: amount chosen token that user received

setAdminFee(SwapUtils.FeeParams storage,.details: adminFee cannot be higher than 100% of the swap fee

params.newAdminFee: new admin fee to be applied on future transactions

setSwapFee(SwapUtils.FeeParams storage,u.details: fee cannot be higher than 1% of each swap

params.newSwapFee: new swap fee to be applied on future transactions

params.dx: the number of tokens to sell
params.minDy: the min amount the user would like to receive (revert if not met)

returns._0: amount of token user received on swap

calculateRemoveLiquidity(uint256,SwapUti.notice: A simple method to calculate amount of each underlying tokens that is returned upon burning given amount of LP tokens

calculateSwap(SwapUtils.PooledToken stor.notice: Externally calculates a swap between two tokens.

calculateTokenAmount(SwapUtils.PooledTok.notice: A simple method to calculate prices from deposits or withdrawals, excluding fees but including slippage. This is helpful as an input into the various "min" parameters on calls to fight front-running

getA(SwapUtils.Amplification storage).notice: Return A, the amplification coefficient * n * (n - 1)

getAPrecise(SwapUtils.Amplification stor.notice: Return A in its raw precision

getVirtualPrice(SwapUtils.PooledToken st.notice: Get the virtual price, to help calculate profit

rampA(SwapUtils.Amplification storage,ui.notice: Start ramping up or down A parameter towards given futureA_ and futureTime_ Checks if the change is too rapid, and commits the new A value only when it falls under the limit range.

removeLiquidity(uint256,SwapUtils.Pooled.notice: Burn LP tokens to remove liquidity from the pool.

removeLiquidityImbalance(SwapUtils.Poole.notice: Remove liquidity from the pool, weighted differently than the pool's current balances.

removeLiquidityOneToken(uint256,SwapUtil.notice: Remove liquidity from the pool all in one token.

stopRampA(SwapUtils.Amplification storag.notice: Stops ramping A immediately. Once this function is called, rampA() cannot be called for another 24 hours

swap(SwapUtils.PooledToken storage,SwapU.notice: swap two tokens in the pool
